result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon A Murrenus

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.

The Court recesses at 10:11 for the Defendant to fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork.
The Court recalls the matter at 10:22 AM with the same appearances.

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.
The Court orders the Defendant to go to the Business Center right after court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing and will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant is asking for additional time to seek counsel.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Although DNA sample ordered, offense does not qualify therefore sample not taken by Waukesha County Sheriff Dept.
Hearing on March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on February 23, 2022.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Court orders the GPS monitoring that was placed on the defendant may be removed and she should report to WCS after Court today for the removal.

02:04 PM Defendant Shannon A Murrenus in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court orders the GPS monitoring that was placed on the defendant may be removed and she should report to WCS after Court today for the removal.  Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
